p: Early warning systems (EWS) also have been explored for a range of the vector-borne and infectious diseases tracked by public health agencies [ 98, 104, 105]. For example, the European Environment and Epidemiology Network has tested with success three prototype case studies of diseases transmitted by mosquitos that hold promise for scaled-up early warning efforts: malaria in Greece; West Nile fever in Southeastern Europe; and dengue fever in Madeira [ 98]. Efforts are also underway to examine early warning for diseases associated with flooding [ 106], as well as for cholera and schistosomiasis among others [ 107, 108]. Challenges with infectious disease EWS include complexities of disease transmission, insufficient data, and human mobility [ 109, 110].
